introduction:
I am a Research Scientist at CSIRO's Data61 in the Distributed Sensing Systems group. In my research, I am broadly interested in Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS). This includes Intelligent and Multi-modal Sensing Systems, Internet of Things (IoT) and Embedded Intelligence. Check past and ongoing projects.
Prior to the current position, I was a postdoc in CSIRO's Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence Future Science Platform. I obtained my PhD in Computer Science from the University of New South Wales in Sydney under the main supervision of Prof. Wen Hu.My PhD background is in Radio-based Sensing (example past works include RFWash and WiRelax )

news.content: I was invited to serve as a Session Chair (mmWave Sensing) in International Conference in Pervasive and Ubiquitous Computing (UbiComp 24)
A demo on Object Multimodal Sensing was accepted in International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI 24)
I was invited to serve as a TPC in UbiComp/ISWC 2024
Our paper on Scalable Optimal Transport was accepted by IEEE TPAMI .
I was invited to serve as a TPC in International Workshop on Foundation Models for Cyber-Physical Systems & Internet of Things (FMSys 24)
I was invited to serve as a TPC in ACM/IEEE International Conference on Information Processing in Sensor Networks (IPSN 24)
I was invited to serve as a TPC in CM/IEEE Conference on Internet of Things Design and Implementation (IoTDI 24)

project.intro: In this project, we exploit Radio-Frequency-Vision (RF-vision) capable of bypassing obstacles for build the first 3D RF-based (occluded) Hand Pose Estimation, OCHID-Fi.

publication.title: OCHID-Fi: Occlusion-Robust Hand Pose Estimation in 3D via RF-Vision
